Incremental update 1.5.26 ( a patch to update 1.5.24)

Bug Fixes (Same as the beta...)


Fixed issue with frequency of first person kill cameras Underwater effects now display properly

Fixed crash when loading certain plugins (PC Only)
 Fixed issue where sun would not appear properly after fast travel

To everyone that can't load a saved game or gets random ctd at load! Ccleaner is your answer. I fought for weeks to get an update that worked and to get skse to work. I finally got one update to load but it crashed whenever I'd load saved games and gave me errors when starting new. I used CCleaner to fix all registry errors and it worked flawlessly! If all else fails, back up save folder then delete skyrim run CCleaner then reinstall and paste your save files back.

   To all those having problems; have you tried running as admin?
Are you running W7 64bit?( some games/cracks require W7 and/or DX11 to run properly .)
Did you copy to the right folder? (i.e. the one witch requires you to authorize any number of files?
How dirty is your regestry? try cleaning that up.
When was the last time you updated your DX files from a validated source?
Try updating both windows and ALL your drivers. (newer high-end games that are packed full of glitches like this one usually require Everything to be up to date.)
Try rebooting your computer after the install or try running it on lower settings.
Make sure you have TESV installed in the x86 program files folder, and that its not in there too deep.
Double check the integrity of the torrent, the files, and that either you, or your anti-virus didn't accidently delete something.
Try re-installing/downloading with your anti-virus off, or simply re installing/downloading. (while making sure to use the correct installer, if their is more than one.)

   Lastly, make sure your not an idiot and you know WTF your doing, lol, ..and make sure your system meets or exceeds the requirements, along with all the pysx-shadder-bullshit 3.0 that these games need to work properly.

   If none of this or what was said in the other comments helps, take it to youtube or google. ...and try looking for problems related to your setup.

Okay, having read the entire comments section had me worried and prepared for the worse. I thought I'd have to deal with CTD's and save game corruptions for the next couple of hours... but much to my surprise, everything is - so far - working smoothly, after applying the patch.

An hour into the game and no crash, no mod or save incompatibility. I did not uninstall my mods, I did not delete my saves. I simply pasted the contents of the download onto my Skyrim directory(except for steamapi.dll, since I use CK).

I'm not even kidding.  Is this too good to be true? Or did anyone else also managed to do it successfully? I'm not complaining or anything, it's just that usually, when everything is all going great, there's a catch. So are there any repercussions I should expect for keeping my mods and saves?

@Esbern

If you want to make a torrent file you will need to download a torrent client like utorrent or bitTorrent etc.

I'm using utorrent. It's as simple as starting utorrent, then file->create new torrent. Then you select the files you wish to include in the torrent.

Next, upload the .torrent file with your stuff onto TPB (that is - here). Than simply seed it long enough (seed it trough your torrent client - you have to start the torrent you have created) too get it started and you will heave plenty of other seeders in no time.

Hope it helps..

@markymonkeymark 
Find your TESV file in your Elder Scrolls folder. Go over it with the mouse but don't click it. A description should pop out. If not click over it -> right mouse -> Properties -> Details. There search for the file version. If you don't want to do that. Start your Skyrim -> Load a save -> After loading open your menu as for saving. In the bottom left corner of the menu you can see your Skyrim version.  You are wellcome  :)
